sentences.en: “It takes a carefully trained expert to tease out the truth”(&b{Arthur Green})
sentences.cn: “需要一个受过训练的专家弄清真相”(&b{阿瑟·格林})

sentences.en: Do not tease roaming dogs and macaque.
sentences.cn: 不要去欺负流浪狗和短尾猿。

sentences.en: Don’t get upset. I was only teasing .
sentences.cn: 别生气，我只是在逗你玩。

sentences.en: Don't provoke or tease the animals in the cage.
sentences.cn: 不要触怒或刺激在笼中的动物.

sentences.en: He used to tease her mercilessly .
sentences.cn: 他过去总是无情地取笑她。

sentences.en: He used to tease her mercilessly.
sentences.cn: 他过去总是无情地取笑她。

sentences.en: He'd be capable of coming to seek me, to tease Edgar.
sentences.cn: 他可以来找我去逗逗埃德加.

sentences.en: His friends used to tease him about his tatty clothes.
sentences.cn: 他的朋友过去常常笑话他破旧的衣服.

sentences.en: It was mean of you to tease the little boy.
sentences.cn: 你戏弄那个小男孩,你真坏.
我弟弟太喜欢戏弄人了。

sentences.en: My sad thoughts tease me asking me their own names.
sentences.cn: 我的忧思缠绕着我,要问我它自己的名字.

sentences.en: The best way to deal with a tease is to ignore him.
sentences.cn: 对付爱捉弄人的人的最佳方法就是不搭理他。

sentences.en: The boys would tease you to death if they didn'tfancy you.
sentences.cn: 如果男孩们不喜欢你的话，他们就会狠狠地捉弄你。

sentences.en: The other boys tease him because he is fat.
sentences.cn: 因为他很胖,所以其他男生都取笑他.

sentences.en: The other boys used to tease him because of / about his accent.
sentences.cn: 别的男孩子常拿他的口音取笑他.

sentences.en: The wind were swooping down to tease the waves.
sentences.cn: 大风猛扑到海面上戏弄着浪涛.

sentences.en: They try to tease out the answers without appearing to ask.
sentences.cn: 他们试图不动声色地套出答案。

sentences.en: When did you last flirt with him or tease him?
sentences.cn: 你上次和他调情或挑逗他是什么时候？

words.tran_cn: 戏弄；爱纠缠的小孩；挑逗者；卖弄风骚的女孩

phrases.tran_cn: 哄取：通过或好象通过用锋利的工具或装置解开或放出而得到

trans.tran_cn: 爱嘲弄他人的人，取笑卖弄风骚的人
trans.tran_en: someone who enjoys making jokes at people, and embarrassing them, especially in a friendly way
to laugh at someone and make jokes in order to have fun by embarrassing them, either in a friendly way or in an unkind way
to laugh at someone and make jokes in order to have fun by embarrassing them, either in a friendly way or in an unkind way
